alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following county, Claiborne. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area during the next three hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Tazewell, Tazewell, Harrogate, Powell River Preserve, Arthur, Springdale, Lone Mountain, Sandlick and Cumberland Gap. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
